body:
### Describe the bug

While building lxml from source (the Cythonized source files wasn't compatible with Cython 3.1.0a and building with free-threaded interpreter), the following error occured:

```

Building wheels for collected packages: lxml
  Building wheel for lxml (pyproject.toml) ... error

            |                                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

            |               ^~~~~~

          3 |     xmlXPathInit();
            |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~

      cc tmp/xmlXPathInittjav56gs.o -lxml2 -o a.out
      error: command '/opt/gcc-latest/bin/gcc' failed with exit code 1
      [end of output]
  
  note: This error originates from a subprocess, and is likely not a problem with pip.
  ERROR: Failed building wheel for lxml
Failed to build lxml
ERROR: ERROR: Failed to build installable wheels for some pyproject.toml based projects (lxml)

```

I've already reported this to lxml's maintainer, but received a rejection stating that the issue will not be resolved until the first stable release of 3.14

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

Found in https://github.com/lxml/lxml/blob/475f4ab305d3b6eccb0520e9298a6cf829ffcf75/src/lxml/etree.pyx


### Expected behaviour

Successful compilation

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.14.0a2

### Cython version

3.1.0a2

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
`PY_NEW` is declared inside lxml and explicitly uses `__pyx_empty_tuple` (https://github.com/lxml/lxml/blob/475f4ab305d3b6eccb0520e9298a6cf829ffcf75/src/lxml/includes/etree_defs.h#L193). Cython has moved `__pyx_empty_tuple` into the module state so it's no longer directly accessible as a global variable.

So this is definitely something for lxml to fix rather than Cython.

The maintainer is lxml is also a maintainer of Cython so is well-aware of the above information and how to fix it. So I think you just have to be patient for a fix there.

(if you want to fix it yourself then replace `__pyx_empty_tuple` with `PyTuple_New(0)`. That's unlikely to be accepted as a long-term fix because it's missing some error handling. But it should work as a placeholder)

> `PY_NEW` is declared inside lxml and explicitly uses `__pyx_empty_tuple` (https://github.com/lxml/lxml/blob/475f4ab305d3b6eccb0520e9298a6cf829ffcf75/src/lxml/includes/etree_defs.h#L193). Cython has moved `__pyx_empty_tuple` into the module state so it's no longer directly accessible as a global variable.
> 
> So this is definitely something for lxml to fix rather than Cython.
> 
> The maintainer is lxml is also a maintainer of Cython so is well-aware of the above information and how to fix it. So I think you just have to be patient for a fix there.

Can you point where `__pyx_empty_tuple` is defined within the repo?

> `PY_NEW` is declared inside lxml and explicitly uses `__pyx_empty_tuple`

I removed the macro a while ago. It's not part of a release yet but you can try the latest master branch of lxml. Doesn't mean that it'll work with Cython 3.1 already, but at least this issue should be gone.

title: [BUG] '__pyx_empty_tuple’ undeclared in expansion of macro ‘PY_NEW'
